result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Goddard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co. Case No. 15CF99

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a HSED during the first year of the probation term. Defendant to obtain an associate degree during the pendency of probation term.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J Goddard

records.addlTxt: Discharge - Early

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

15CF99 & 15CF110 Cases called @ 3:06 p.m. Defendant Thomas J Goddard in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15CF99: Ct 1 - Guilty. 15CF110: Ct 1 - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Second and subsequent offense enhancer dismissed outright on both cases. 15CF99: Cts 2 & 3 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 4 yrs probation - Conditions: 15CF110 - Ct 1 only - 75 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than January 8, 2015. As to both counts: Within a period of one year DE to obtain an HSED. Defendant to have an associates degree by the end of the probation term. AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs to include $100 drug buy money w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. As to both cases - Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi request Plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS.  2015CF000099 and 2015CF000110:  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. 15CF-99 and 15CF-110 - Both Cases Called @ 1:40 PM:  Defendant Thomas J Goddard in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Both Complaints Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  ADA argues as to $2500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 20 day time limits for preliminary hearing as to each case.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:10 pm.
